books.title: Ragged Dick
books.author: Horatio Alger Jr.
books.summary: A young shoeshiner rises the social ladder thanks to his wits, his work ethic, his honesty, and a bit of luck.

books.title: Running a Thousand Miles for Freedom
books.author: William Craft
books.summary: The authors escape from slavery by posing as a slaveowner and his slave.

books.title: My Reminiscences
books.author: Rabindranath Tagore
books.summary: Autobiographical sketches from the Bengali writer, poet, and artist Rabindranath Tagore.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: Treasure Island
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A young boy finds adventure on the high seas as he battles bloodthirsty pirates in search of a long-lost treasure.

books.title: The Crock of Gold
books.author: James Stephens
books.summary: A philosopher sets out to rescue the beautiful Caitilin Ni Murrachu from the god Pan in an adventure that involves leprechauns, Celtic gods, policemen, and philosophical disquisitions both profound and absurd.

books.title: The Two Gentlemen of Verona
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Two best friends become involved in a love triangle.

books.title: The Sketchbook of Geoffrey Crayon, Gent.
books.author: Washington Irving
books.summary: A collection of 34 essays and short stories, including “The Legend of Sleepy Hollow” and “Rip Van Winkle.”

books.title: William—An Englishman
books.author: Cicely Hamilton
books.summary: A young activist couple’s lives turn for the worse when the unexpected arrival of foreign soldiers interrupts their honeymoon.

books.title: The Room in the Dragon Volant
books.author: J. Sheridan Le Fanu
books.summary: After an Englishman traveling in France meets a mysterious woman, he becomes embroiled in a dangerous intrigue.

books.title: A Negro Explorer at the North Pole
books.author: Matthew Henson
books.summary: The self-told story of the black man who accompanied Robert Peary during the first trip to the North Pole.

books.title: The Shore Road Mystery
books.author: Franklin W. Dixon
books.summary: Two amateur slueths endeavor to break up a carjacking ring.

books.title: The Book of Tea
books.author: Okakura Kakuzō
books.summary: The Book of Tea is a long essay exploring the relationship between teaism, taoism, and the aesthetics of Japanese culture.

books.title: The Rights of Man
books.author: Thomas Paine
books.summary: A philosopher and political activist presents a forceful argument in favor of the principles of the French Revolution and of republicanism in general, together with a condemnation of monarchy and hereditary power in general.

books.title: Hudibras
books.author: Samuel Butler
books.summary: A knight and his squire set forth for adventure and love.

books.title: The Mercy of Allah
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: An entrepreneurial businessman satirically relates to his nephews how he became the wealthiest man in Baghdad.

books.title: Metropolis
books.author: Thea von Harbou
books.summary: In a futuristic dystopian city, the son of the city’s mastermind falls in love with a revolutionary activist.

books.title: Hindu Tales from the Sanskrit
books.author: S. M. Mitra
books.summary: Short stories and fables from the Sanskrit tradition.

books.title: Unspoken Sermons
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: George MacDonald presents a set of interlocking sermons designed to shape the perception and life of the Christian disciple.

books.title: To Cuba and Back
books.author: Richard Henry Dana Jr.
books.summary: A captivating travel memoir recounting an 1859 journey to Cuba, offering vivid descriptions of the island’s culture, landscapes, and people.
